description: Lenart Kova uses his access as a systems maintenance contractor to copy confidential BCI watchlist logs. He compiles the names of vanished citizens and prepares anonymous distribution materials.

Envelopes containing hard-copy lists of missing citizens appear at community centers and key gathering spots, following instructions for wide distribution. Trusted local contacts begin circulating the documents.
Flyers listing names of the disappeared blanket major squares and transit hubs, igniting citywide alarm. Grassroots groups mobilize to search for the missing and demand answers from the authorities.

After days of public pressure and grassroots searches, several missing citizens return home. They avoid media and official inquiries, but their distressed state and partial accounts of secret detainment sites intensify skepticism about Council actions.

As stories of disappearances and hidden detainment circulate, disillusionment fractures the Council’s Harmonist bloc. Public trust in the BCI system and its proponents collapses as Council alliances break down.
